attributes.action: Save historically important 1841 Redhill locoshed from demolition
attributes.additional_details:
Photos can be seen on the Reigate Society website at http://www.reigatesociety.org.uk/noticeboard/Locoshed_petition.php
The history of the original Redhill station built in 1841 and replaced by the new station in 1844 can be seen in an article written by John Capon http://www.reigatesociety.org.uk/noticeboard/Old%20Redhill%20Station.pdf
attributes.background: The original Redhill Station was built in 1841 by the London & Brighton Railway. The architecturally important Locomotive shed is due for demolition in mid 2018; this was approved on appeal and against local wishes. This is one of the earliest buildings in Redhill and deserves to be preserved.

rejection.details:
We aren't able to accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Local planning issues are the responsibility of your local council. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out how to contact Reigate and Banstead councillors:

http://www.reigate-banstead.gov.uk/info/20319/borough_councillors

Your local council also has a petitions process, which you can find out more about here:

http://petitions.reigate-banstead.gov.uk/

If you would like to apply for the building to be listed, you can do that here:

https://historicengland.org.uk/listing/apply-for-listing/
